Context: The George Brown College provides international and intercultural learning opportunities for its community and partners. These opportunities include spending 1-2 weeks or semesters in various countries, studying at international partner institutions, completing international co-ops, internships or field placements, and gaining additional credentials abroad. Students can also enjoy 1-2 semesters studying at George Brown College and gain additional credentials there. Interested individuals can contact globalmobility@georgebrown.ca for more information and sign up for updates on application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more. The phone numbers provided are 416-415-2000 and TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and students can also contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca for inquiries. The college has been awarded Gold by Colleges and Institutes Canada for internationalization excellence. The information on the website is subject to change without notice and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
